name: Melbourne Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: This is what u wud expect from a Marriott hotel -Curteous and friendly staff, neat rooms. Stayed here for 3 nights with my family in interleading rooms. Convenient if u want to create one big room but the interleading doors opened in funny angles so was cumbersome to leave open all the time. Although there were plenty eating places, there wasnt much halal food. Just like everywhere we have been in Australia muslims pls b cautious on dubious food joints stating they are halal when they are not! Most of them are still listed on Zabihah.com and need to be removed. Not all Nandos are halal. Only the ones with halal certificates do not have bacon on their menu. Only one i found was at the Harbourside near the kids rides playground. Found a Madinah islamic centre just up the road from Marriott and a halal cafe next door serving curries just where u take the tram on La Trobe street. Many many thanks to Peter, Yasin and Harry whom have made our stay very comfortable and esp Harry and Emma who attended to our dietary needs at breakfast and room service.
reviews.title: Although not in a prime location but a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed there for a week,
reviews.title: Big room, great shower, king bed, giant tv,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff, friendly, helpful and always happy and polite.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great room service meals.
reviews.title: Above & Beyond Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tennis was on and some of the players stayed there.
reviews.title: Marriott in Melbourne, Australia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just checked out of a very well planned hotel. Everything worked from check in to check out. Room was very spacious with small couch and separate work desk. Huge window let in lots of light. Bedside control's for room lights, bedside table light, overhead reading lights (a big plus) and night light. Very large flat screen TV with easy to use remote. Extra large bathroom. Doubledoor closet with safe, iron etc. You can tell that whoever designed the room spent a lot of time in hotel rooms and used the best ideas.
reviews.title: Well thought out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location was good. Walking distance to Chinatown, Greektown, and lots of places to eat and shop.
reviews.title: A great short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here from Boxing Day for a couple of nights, the staff are very helpful and the concierge and his colleagues were fantastic as we needed to get to our cars on several occasions (the valet parking is a huge bonus in Melbourne).
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location to walk into the CBD or catch the free tourist bus around the city – a fantastic hotel to explore the city from.
reviews.title: Good for business and leisure and families are most welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent a week here from Christmas to New Years... it was great! We stayed in the very comfortable, roomy king suite with great views (corner room), and the location of the hotel can't be beat. It is within walking distance to several great spots (Bourke Street, Yarra Riverwalk). The concierges were all quite helpful - and one helped us arrange a fantastic tour of Phillip Island through the Gray Line Tours. The room was spotless everyday -- the maid service is top notch.
reviews.title: Xmas Holiday with the Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a week, mainly for the Oz Open tennis, 23 - 30 Jan 2013.
reviews.title: Solid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value, well positioned, and well appointed hotel.
reviews.title: Rip off wifi!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and efficient staff.
reviews.title: A stay to remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visit Melbourne every year and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great service, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights paid a whopping €415 per night ( Australian tennis open was on ) then got charged €4.95 per day for wifi!!!
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and accommodating staff. After discovering our first room was very close to the lifts/elevators I asked if we could be moved. They did not hesitate my request and we were moved. I was given maps, directions, suggestions on places to visit. The room was spacious including the bathroom Very clean and very nice. Much extra help was offered in setting up our free wifi service, also. I would recommend this hotel offer airport shuttle service as that seemed to be my only dislike of this hotel.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are very pleasant at this hotel and are helpful. From check-in to check-out everybody was friendly.
reviews.title: Convenient And Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is convenient and an easy walk to most attractions in the city.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was of a good size. Beds were comfortable and had soft pillows which allowed for a good sleep. The bathroom is a good size with a shower only which I don't mind as prefer it over having a shower over bath. If you are a Marriott Rewards member you get free wifi in the room but didn't try it as didn't have the need for it.
reviews.title: Average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still as good as my previous stays so would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Marriott Hotel with no surprises -

description: Located in the heart of the city, the luxury Melbourne Marriott Hotel features exceptional facilities and service that is unparalleled amongst other Melbourne luxury hotels. Boutique in size, yet grand in style, the Marriott offers the perfect welcome. Featuring spacious rooms, starting from 36 square meters in size, our luxury Melbourne hotel's accommodations are at the center of the city's theater precinct and just minutes from the shopping delights of Bourke and Collins streets, as well as the cultural and culinary extravaganza of Chinatown, Melbourne Museum and Royal Exhibition Building. For sports enthusiasts, our hotel is a short walk from MCG and Rod Laver Arena and only a seven-minute tram ride to Etihad Stadium. And for business travelers, we offer stylish, state-of-the-art event space for up to 250 guests, as well as on-site event managers, exceptional catering and a full-service business center. Discover a leader among luxury Melbourne hotels at Marriott.
